item.description:
If you were a voter or candidate at a caucus on April 28 in Massachusetts to select delegates to the Republican National Convention please support the Federal Civil Voting Rights Complaint recently filed on Monday, June 11, 2012 by Attorney Richard Gilbert on behalf of disenfranchised and injured Republican state and national delegates and alternate delegates in the U.S. 9th Circuit Southern District Court in Santa Ana, California.Â  The complaint can be viewed here:

https://www.toolsforjustice.com/members/forum/102
(Note: you must register on the site first)

You can join the complaint as a caucus voter and/or delegate either as a plaintiff or as a witness on the Tools for Justice website.

The complaint requests the court to issue an injunction against the Republican Party to allow duly elected delegates to attend the 2012 national convention.

Please distribute them far and wide so that we may help ALL delegates to benefit from this civil lawsuit prior to the National Republican Party

Convention in Tampa, Florida in August, 2012.

Thank you,

LAWYERS FOR RON PAUL / ToolsForJustice Legal Team
support@toolsforjustice.com
850-417-8543 / 561-747-8596
http://electionfraudremedy.com
http://toolsforjustice.com
item.name: Federal Complaint for Delegate Freedom at Republican National Convention
